image.altText: Smoke rises up over flames and a night sky.

props.synopsis: On Thursday night a damning report found Iran had failed to comply with its nuclear obligations — the first time in almost 20 years.

title.children: Israel's 'Operation Rising Lion' against Iran sees conflict escalate

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures as Benjamin Netanyahu leaves the West Wing.

props.synopsis: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu is showing his willingness to go it alone and ignore pressure from the Trump administration.

title.children: The Middle East is undergoing a realignment of power, sending the US a signal

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wearing a black suit jacket, white shirt and red tie while waving outside the entry door of a plane

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will visit the Seattle headquarters of tech giant Amazon to spruik a multi-billion-dollar expansion of Australian data centres, ahead of flying to Canada for the G7 summit.

title.children: ‘A powerful symbol’: Albanese spruiks US tech giant’s investment ahead of possible talks with Trump

image.altText: public milling about near a tank, parked in washington near the capitol building

props.synopsis: The parade for the US Army's birthday — which coincides with the US president's birthday — is on the same weekend the country will see hundreds of protests on immigration raids.

title.children: Rare military parade coincides with widespread protests over Trump

image.altText: Two bullet holes are seen in a property's window as yellow police tape is strung across the bottom of the frame

props.synopsis: An Australian man dies in a shooting incident in Bali, local police say, with another injured Australian being treated in hospital.

title.children: Australian man dead in Bali villa shooting incident, local police say

image.altText: Pat Cummins and Travis Head in the World Test Championship final

props.synopsis: An Aiden Markram century guides South Africa to a five-wicket win over Australia in the World Test Championship final at Lord's.

title.children: 'That one stings': Aussies lament losing Test world title to South Africa

image.altText: Jack Bostock dives for the line

props.synopsis: Dolphins have racked up 10 tries in a Queensland derby demolition of the North Queensland Cowboys in Townsville, with Jack Bostock scoring four tries. Earlier, the Roosters came from behind to beat Newcastle 12-8 in a dramatic contest at Hunter Stadium.

title.children: Dolphins demolish 'inept' Cowboys, Knights question late call in Roosters defeat

image.altText: GettyImages-2219360237

props.synopsis: Fremantle hang on against North Melbourne to make it four wins in a row. It comes after a young Essendon side was handed a hefty 95-point defeat by Geelong. Follow live.

title.children: Dockers survive scare from Kangaroos, Cats hand Bombers 95-point defeat

image.altText: The royal family appear on Buckingham Palace's balcony and look up towards the sky

props.synopsis: King Charles III wore a black armband at the Trooping the Colour military parade as a mark of respect for the victims of the Air India plane crash.

title.children: Royals unite for Trooping the Colour as King Charles honours Air India victims

image.altText: A woman lying on the ground with her eyes closed. She is wearing jeans and a cropped black top and has several tattoos.

props.synopsis: Mothers who planned freebirths that ended in a hospital transfer say they've been "gaslit" or "abandoned" by birth workers and kicked out of group chats meant to support them. The movement is facing increasing criticism for "groupthink" and "extremism".

title.children: 'It was a cult': Mothers seduced by freebirth movement describe trauma and exclusion

image.altText: a man on security vision walks out of a parking lot

props.synopsis: A former police chief convicted of rape and murder donned a makeshift uniform and walked out of a high security prison — sparking a days-long manhunt across Arkansas's mountain terrain.

title.children: How the 'Devil in the Ozarks' walked out of maximum security prison

image.altText: A collection of Game Boys.

props.synopsis: Not so long ago, old video games and consoles were the kind of thing you found in hard rubbish — or maybe at a garage sale. Now, they're collectibles. Sometimes extremely valuable ones.

title.children: 'Nostalgia-fuelled binge': How the $US2 million retro video game bubble burst

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Amid repeated prosecution accusations of murder, deceit and cover-up, there were exchanges about the right time for a "lie down" and errors in the days of the week, as Erin Patterson finished her evidence.

title.children: The moments from Erin Patterson's evidence that didn't make headlines

image.altText: A distraught man puts his face in his hands as someone nearby puts an arm on his shoulder and other offers a bottle of water.

props.synopsis: Surviving a mass disaster like the Air India crash may be hailed as a kind of "miracle". But what is it like to survive – especially as the only one?

title.children: Just one man survived the Air India crash. He's likely to have many questions

image.altText: Brian To'o celebrates a try for NSW in State of Origin I.

props.synopsis: NSW winger Brian To'o will play in State of Origin II after completing the Blues' final training session before they fly to Perth.

title.children: Blues make call on Panthers star for State of Origin II

image.altText: nsw snowy mountains covered in snow

props.synopsis: Much of central and eastern Australia has shivered through its coldest first fortnight of winter in at least three years.

title.children: Winter cold spell won't last as weather this season to warm up

image.altText: Sheep and ram bones on the ground

props.synopsis: The farming town of Orroroo, in South Australia's mid north, is a microcosm of the drought plaguing swathes of Australia. What is its future in a changing climate?

title.children: In one town, the impact of climate change is starkly felt by the next generation

image.altText: Two skiers, with backs to the camera, at the top of a mountain beside a ski lift.

props.synopsis: Towns in the Snowy Mountains rely on tourist dollars during winter, but as the cost of living bites, Aussies are looking for ways to enjoy snow holidays on a budget.

title.children: How Aussies are affording a 'bloody expensive' trip to the snow

image.altText: Lamb cutlets on a bed of rosemary in front of national flags.

props.synopsis: Australian producers are fetching "phenomenal" prices for lambs as overseas customers buy record amounts.

title.children: Record prices for Aussie lamb as export demand surges

image.altText: A man wearing an orange cap and black t-shirt stands in a park while holding green balloons with a rainbow in the background.

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer has finished his 250th Parkrun — a milestone he set after he was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer.

title.children: Professor Richard Scolyer celebrates milestone set after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A survivor of institutional child sex abuse has won a "landmark" claim for negligence against one of Australia's most prominent law firms.

title.children: Abuse survivor wins 'landmark' case against high-profile law firm

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

props.synopsis: The average home in Australia has surpassed $1 million for the first time, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The main drivers of the rise were increases in house prices in Western Australia, South Australia and Queensland.

title.children: Average house price surpasses $1 million, sparking affordability fears

image.altText: A smiling man puts his arms around an older woman in a hat while they sit in front of a large painting in an art gallery.

props.synopsis: Tweed Regional Gallery's acquisition of Ben Quilty's Archibald Prize-winning portrait of beloved Australian artist Margaret Olley brings with it a sense of homecoming.

title.children: Regional gallery raises $600k to bring Archibald-winning portrait home

image.altText: Black and white photo of a large group of teenage boys on a ship deck

props.synopsis: Identical twins Alistair and Alex Macdonald came to Australia at 16 through the Big Brother Movement in 1955. They returned this year to the Blighty farm where their new life began 70 years ago.

title.children: 'We were uncouth youth': The legacy of 15,000 boys sent to Aussie farms

image.altText: A pig in a pen.

props.synopsis: Experts say tiny pigs are a myth and some sold as pets can become a giant problem, with one owner saying her mini pig is now almost big enough to ride like a horse.

title.children: 'Teacup' pigs weighing up to 300kg surrendered by dismayed buyers

image.altText: An elderly man holding up a piece of jewellery and a small eye-piece smiling at the camera. In the background in his workshop

props.synopsis: Scores of small and medium businesses are closing across Victoria as online shops boom outside the legal commitments of bricks-and-mortar retailers.

title.children: Surging $69b online shopping market puts small family business legacies at risk

image.altText: Mexican Flag Los Angeles protests

props.synopsis: Small protests have since spread to other parts of the US. But few are surprised that the fiercest resistance to Trump’s immigrant deportation plan started in Los Angeles.

title.children: Why the Mexican flag has taken over the streets of LA

image.altText: A diver swims above a large whale shark with the surface of the water above.

props.synopsis: Residents say there's nothing to fear after two people were stung by Irukandji jellyfish, following reports of sharks and crocodiles along Ningaloo coast in recent months.

title.children: Crocs, sharks and deadly jellyfish sighted in tourist hotspot

image.altText: A solid gold toilet sculpture

props.synopsis: Two men have been jailed for stealing an 18-carat golden toilet that was on display at Winston Churchill's birthplace.

title.children: Two UK men jailed for 'bold and brazen' golden toilet heist

image.altText: A whole roasted cauliflower is cut open after baking, revealing melted cheese. It's topped with chopped parsley.

props.synopsis: This whole roasted cauliflower uses the simplest of ingredients, resulting in a side dish that is full of flavour and oozing with melted, gooey cheese.

title.children: This whole roasted cauliflower is easy and cheesy

image.altText: A Brisbane street.

props.synopsis: The new policy will see tenants exited from public housing if they are warned over serious or nuisance behaviour three times in a year.

title.children: Queensland public housing tenants to face eviction after three strikes in a year

image.altText: Three chickens on the grass.

props.synopsis: Agriculture Victoria has declared four properties in Euroa free from avian influenza after disease eradication activities.

title.children: Restrictions lifted as latest bird flu outbreak in Victoria eradicated

image.altText: Australian golfer Jason Day smiles and runs his hand through his hair as he stands with a competitor on the green.

props.synopsis: Adam Scott is tied for fourth, while fellow Australian Jason Day has also roared into US Open contention during a dramatic second round at Oakmont Country Club.

title.children: Surging Scott, Day in US Open mix as superstars crash

image.altText: Dark-haired Woman in a black and white stripped footy guernsey ready to kick the ball while on the field.

props.synopsis: A number of players in a Victorian women's league are calling for a male player to be suspended over allegations of sexual assault.

title.children: Female footballers boycott major game over alleged sexual assault

image.altText: Singer Brian Wilson performs with the Beach Boys on stage

props.synopsis: The simple purity of God Only Knows, and the glorious harmonies of its recorded version have become a touchstone of modern music, and a shared password of musical passion.

title.children: Our beloved musicians hold the secrets to us — keep them close
